intro: Rhamnus rosei, commonly known as the roseleaf buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features small, oval leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by small, dark berries in the autumn. Its leaves and fruits contain anthraquinones, which have been used in traditional medicine. Rhamnus rosei thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and rocky areas.
